DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether the use of honey mouthwashes in the prevention of salivary side effects of 131I (radioiodine) therapy.
DOC.brief_title: The Use of Candy and Honey in Decreasing Salivary Gland Damage Following Radioiodine Therapy for Thyroid Cancer
DOC.criteria: >18 years old They had a histological diagnosis of papillary, follicular, medullary or anaplastic thyroid cancer They had undergone total thyroidectomy They were able to provide consent patients who had distant metastases, a history of salivarygland disorders, collagen tissue disease diabetes mellitus, previous radioiodine therapy or external radiation to the head or neck allergy to the honey
